snippet: Wholesale prices rose 0.8 percent in June compared with May when prices had risen 0.5 percent. It was the biggest increase since a 1 percent increase in September.
abstract: Labor Department reports that big increase in gasoline prices pushed wholesale inflation up in June by largest amount in nine months, with underlying inflation showing only modest gain;  says wholesale prices rose 0.8 percent, compared to 0.5 percent in May.
lead_paragraph: Wholesale prices rose 0.8 percent in June compared with May when prices had risen 0.5 percent. It was the biggest increase since a 1 percent increase in September.

headline.main: Nudged by Gas Prices, Wholesale Inflation Rises
headline.print_headline: Nudged by Gas Prices, Wholesale Inflation Rises
